questions.question: How much do solar panels cost?
questions.answer:
Solar panel costs vary based on system size and location. In India, residential systems typically cost ₹40,000-₹80,000 per kW before subsidies. A 5kW home system costs around ₹2-4 lakhs after government subsidies.

Factors affecting cost:
• System size (kW capacity)
• Panel quality and type
• Inverter technology
• Installation complexity
• Location and local regulations

We provide free quotes with detailed cost breakdowns.

questions.question: How much can I save with solar energy?
questions.answer:
Solar savings depend on your current electricity bill and system size. Most customers save 70-90% on their monthly electricity bills.

Example savings for a 5kW system:
• Monthly bill reduction: ₹10,000-₹15,000
• Annual savings: ₹1.2-1.8 lakhs
• 25-year savings: ₹30-45 lakhs

Payback period is typically 3-4 years, after which you enjoy free electricity for 20+ years.

questions.question: What government subsidies are available?
questions.answer:
Multiple government incentives make solar more affordable:

• Central Government Subsidy: Up to ₹18,000 per kW (max 3kW)
• State Subsidies: Additional 10-30% in many states
• Net Metering: Sell excess power back to grid
• Accelerated Depreciation: 40% for businesses
• GST Benefits: 5% GST on solar systems
• Low-interest loans: 2-6% from various banks

Total subsidies can reduce costs by 30-50%.

questions.question: How long does solar installation take?
questions.answer:
Complete solar installation typically takes 3-8 weeks:

• Site survey and design: 1-2 days
• Permits and approvals: 7-15 days
• Equipment procurement: 3-7 days
• Actual installation: 1-3 days
• Grid connection and testing: 2-5 days
• Net metering setup: 7-30 days

We handle all paperwork and coordinate with electricity boards to ensure smooth installation.

questions.question: What's the difference between on-grid, off-grid, and hybrid systems?
questions.answer:
Three main types of solar systems:

**On-Grid (Grid-Tied):**
• Connected to electricity grid
• No battery backup
• Sell excess power back
• Cost: ₹40-60k per kW
• Best for areas with reliable grid

**Off-Grid (Standalone):**
• Complete independence from grid
• Battery backup included
• Works during power cuts
• Cost: ₹80-120k per kW
• Best for remote areas

**Hybrid System:**
• Grid connection + battery backup
• Best of both worlds
• Backup during outages
• Cost: ₹70-100k per kW
• Best for urban areas with frequent power cuts

questions.question: How long do solar panels last and what maintenance is required?
questions.answer:
Solar panels are built to last:

**Lifespan:**
• Solar panels: 25-30 years
• Inverters: 10-15 years
• Batteries (if applicable): 5-10 years
• Performance guarantee: 80% efficiency after 25 years

**Maintenance:**
• Monthly: Visual inspection
• Quarterly: Panel cleaning (more in dusty areas)
• Annually: Professional system checkup
• Monitoring: 24/7 via mobile app

**Maintenance costs:** ₹2,000-5,000 annually
**Cleaning impact:** 15-20% performance loss if not cleaned regularly

We provide comprehensive maintenance packages and 24/7 monitoring services.

questions.question: Can I sell excess electricity back to the grid?
questions.answer:
Yes! Through net metering, you can sell excess electricity back to the grid:

**Net Metering Benefits:**
• Send excess power to grid during the day
• Draw power from grid at night or cloudy days
• Net calculation at month-end
• Get paid for extra units generated

**Process:**
• Net meter installation
• Electricity board approval
• Bi-directional metering
• Monthly billing adjustments

This accelerates your return on investment and can even result in negative electricity bills!

questions.question: Do solar panels work during rain and storms?
questions.answer:
Yes, solar panels are designed to work in all weather conditions:

**Weather Resistance:**
• Rain: Water-resistant, actually helps with cleaning
• Storms: Can withstand 200+ kmph wind speeds
• Hail: Protected by tempered glass
• Snow: Functional down to -40°C
• Heat: Performance maintained up to +85°C

**Cloudy Days:**
• 10-25% power generation continues
• Grid connection compensates for shortfall
• Battery backup in hybrid systems

**Warranty:** 25-year warranty covers all weather-related damage.
